flawed_nl_solution:
There were 1150-150=<<1150-150=980>>980 people who didn't vote for John
That means James got 980*0.7=<<980*0.7=686>>686 votes
So the other candidate got 980-686=<<980-686=294>>294 votes
This means he got 294-150=<<294-150=144>>144 more votes than John.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1000, not 980. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
